result.execSummary:
The defendant Edward L. Body Sr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: ck#16CH075895 picked up by poster with photo ID
Rec'd check #16CH075895 back from USPS - attempted, not known, unable to forward
Cash bond to be refunded per court;  gb/mg  ck#16CH075895

Minutes:  14CM1775/15CM83.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Val Karls.  Cases are resolved.  Victim rights compliance.  

14CM1775 - deft pleads guilty to count 2 (resisting); found guilty by the Court.  Remaining counts are dismissed on State's motion.

15CM83 - deft pleads guilty to both counts; found guilty by the Court.

Sentencing arguments made.  Deft sentenced to 90 days KCJ on each count concurrent.  Credit for 35 days served.  To commence 3/21/15 by 6pm.  Huber allowed.  Costs rolled into sentence.  Bomd to be returned to poster.
Due to ongoing trial, hrg for 3/2/15 moved to 3/3/15 @ 9:30am; attys, DA's office, & conveyance notified via email
Atty Karls reports the cases are settled; time of hrg on 3/2/15 changed to 11:15am

email from Atty Karls to Tami Lema re: requesting to take until Feb. 25th @ 5pm to notify Court if a settlement has been agreed upon.

Minutes:  14CM1775 & 15CM83.  NO RECORD TAKEN.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft not transported from the KCJ due to ongoing jury trial.  Atty Karls sent an email to the court stating the case is not resolved as of yet, but is likely to resolve.  Per Court, case to remain on for JS for 3/2/15 @ 9am.  Attys are to notify the court by 5pm on 2/25/15 if the case is resolved.  No plea bargaining will be allowed after 2/25/15.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
